definition: hometown/native place/CL:個|个[ge4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
regional dish/local cuisine
hometown chicken (item on a menu)
Machia township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan

sentences.english: Tian’s mother asked him to go to a local university in their hometown of Fujian province.
sentences.chinese: 田川的母亲想让他在家乡福建读大学。

sentences.english: The global recession has hit Kumi's hometown hard.
sentences.chinese: 全球的经济衰退给木村的家乡造成了很大的冲击。

sentences.english: Could you compare your lifestyle in your hometown and New York City?
sentences.chinese: 你能比较一下你在家乡和纽约的生活方式吗？

sentences.english: Give me home-cooked food, especially hummus.
sentences.chinese: 我就要家乡菜，尤其是胡姆斯。

sentences.english: He hopes to write reports in English to support the exposure of his hometown to the rest of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他希望通过英文文章向世界展示自己的家乡。

sentences.english: The exhibition of folk customs includes an attractive display of local foods.
sentences.chinese: 家乡风味食品在这届民俗民风展览会上引众人注目。

sentences.english: “It’s like a home cooked meal for me, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “嘻哈音乐对我来说就像一顿家乡大餐，”他说。

sentences.english: At the same time, I knew that in the theater in our hometown I would care.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，我知道在家乡的剧院我就不能这么放肆了。

sentences.english: Travelling merchants supported these home-town inns where they stayed in their travels.
sentences.chinese: 旅行的业主门在旅途中支持这些家乡式的城市客栈。

sentences.english: I still have them at Cloverleaf's home base.
sentences.chinese: 在立体式的家乡的基地我仍然有它们。

sentences.english: This is how folks in my hometown see the world.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们家乡人的体验。

sentences.english: Why do not you make tracks for the train home sleepers it?
sentences.chinese: 你们为什么不为家乡的火车轨道做枕木呢？

sentences.english: The weather in my hometown is very pleasant .
Her strong local accent betrayed her hometown.
sentences.chinese: 口浓浓的乡音可以知道她的家乡。

sentences.english: Unaccustomed to city life, Susan pined for her native hills and streams.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊过不惯城市生活，非常想念她家乡的山山水水。

definition: home/homeland/native place/CL:個|个[ge4]
native place/place of origin/home state or region
to leave one's homeland
foreign land/a place far from home
person living or traveling far from home
alma mater
foreign land/away from one's native place
rustic/village/countryside
native soil/one's native land/one's hometown/local (to an area)
fellow townsman/fellow villager/sb from the same hometown
hometown/native place
to miss/to remember with longing/to long to see again
small town
homesickness
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
local accent/accent of one's native place
